content.question: A <math alttext="20.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of a <math alttext="0.125 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.125</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> monoprotic acid solution is titrated with a <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>H</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> solution of unknown concentration. Based on the titration curve above, what is the molar concentration of the <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>H</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> solution?

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
